member.name: T:AjaxControlToolkit4.ExtenderControlBase
member.summary:
This is the main class for extenders. It has several main jobs:
1) It performs the hookup between an Extender (server) control and the behavior it instantiates 2) It manages interacting with the ScriptManager to get the right scripts loaded 3) It adds some debugging features like ValidationScript and ScriptPath

member.name: T:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.ExtenderControlBaseDesigner`1
member.summary: Designer support for adding and navigating to page methods

The designer here has two main jobs:
1) Modifying the properties of the TargetProperties objects to remove the "TargetControlID" property and add the Control converter. We remove "TargetControlID" because the value will be hanging off of the target control's properties already so it's confusing/redundant. 2) Modifying the name of the Extender property so it's user-configurable.

member.summary: For debugging - setting this causes the extender to load the specified script instead of the one out of the resources. This lets you set breakpoints and modify the script without rebuilding, etc.

member.summary: Signature of the page method for DynamicPopulateExtenderControlBase's web service that is used to support adding/navigating to the page method from the designer

member.name: T:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute
member.summary: The PageMethodSignature attribute is used by Designer classes for Toolkit components that include web services. It decorates a delegate that describes the signature of the web method. The ExtenderControlBaseDesigner will automatically add a DesignerActionItem for each of the page methods on the component.

member.name: M:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Friendly name of the page method

member.name: M:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Friendly name of the page method

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute.FriendlyName
member.summary: Friendly name of the page method displayed in the designer

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute.ServicePathProperty
member.summary: Name of the ServicePath property (to verify that the component isn't using a non-page method)

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute.ServiceMethodProperty
member.summary: Name of the ServiceMethod property which will be used to set the name of the page method, or navigate/repair an existing page method

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute.UseContextKeyProperty
member.summary: Name of the UseContextKey property (which will be set to true if specified). The corresponding contextKey parameter should be included with the signature but will not be set on the extender.
member.remarks: A few components in the Toolkit have an optional second signature to support using a ContextKey property. Ideally they would have had the ContextKey property from the beginning, but we didn't want to break existing customers. This should not be used by most components.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Design.PageMethodSignatureAttribute.IncludeContextParameter
member.summary: Whether the UseContextKeyProperty has been specified

member.example: Ideally, a password should be 20 characters in length to be a strong password.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.PasswordStrength.MinimumNumericCharacters
member.summary: The minimum number if numeric characters required. If there are less than this property, then the password is not considered strong. If there are equal to or more than this value, then this will contribute 15% to the overall password strength percentage value.

member.summary: The position that the help handle is displayed

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.PasswordStrength.RequiresUpperAndLowerCaseCharacters
member.summary: Determines if mixed case passwords are required to be considered strong. If true, then there must be at least one occurrence of mixed case (upper and lower) letters in the password to be considered strong. If there is, this will contribute 20% to the overall password strength percentage value

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.PasswordStrength.CalculationWeightings
member.summary: The Calculation ratios or "weightings" used when calculating a passwords strength. Must be a string with 4 elements separated by a semi colon. Default is '50;15;15;20' which represents ... Password Length: 50% ... Meets Numerics requirements : 15% ... Meets Casing requirements: 15% ... Meets Symbol character requirements: 20%
member.remarks: Total of 4 elements must equal 100

member.name: T:AjaxControlToolkit4.CalendarExtender
member.summary:
The Calendar control extender can be attached to any ASP.NET TextBox control. It provides client-side date-picking functionality with customizable date format and UI in a popup control. You can interact with the calendar by clicking on a day to set the date, or the "Today" link to set the current date.
In addition, the left and right arrows can be used to move forward or back a month. By clicking on the title of the calendar you can change the view from Days in the current month, to Months in the current year. Another click will switch to Years in the current Decade. This action allows you to easily jump to dates in the past or the future from within the calendar control.

member.name: T:AjaxControlToolkit4.ReorderList
member.summary:
This class implements a reorderable, data bindable list control.
It demonstrates writing a control that is AJAX-aware in that it creates and manages a set of ASP.NET AJAX extenders. to imporove it's client experience.
It is also data aware. When supplied with a database that matches an expected format, it will automatically update the sort order of the items. The database must have an integer-typed column that this list can have "ownership" of. By setting this column name into the "SortOrderField" property, reorders will happen automatically.

The UL control The DropWatcherExtender The DraggableListitemExtender The drop template control

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.SliderExtender.RaiseChangeOnlyOnMouseUp
member.summary: This property allows to raise a client-side change event on the extended TextBox. This is useful for example to trigger an UpdatePanel's update when the slider's value changes. If set to true, the change event will be raised only when the user releases the left mouse button on the slider. If set to false, the change event will be raised whenever the slider's value changes. This property is set to true by default to prevent flooding of requests to the web server.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.HoverMenuExtender.OffsetX
member.summary: The additional offset to apply between the target element and the popup element when it is displayed. By default, the elements will be positioned with no space between them. By specifying a value here, that amount of space, in pixels, will be added to the positioning. The number can be negative to cause an overlap.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.HoverMenuExtender.OffsetY
member.summary: The additional offset to apply between the target element and the popup element when it is displayed. By default, the elements will be positioned with no space between them. By specifying a value here, that amount of space, in pixels, will be added to the positioning. The number can be negative to cause an overlap.

member.name: M:AjaxControlToolkit4.Animation.Parse(System.String,System.Web.UI.ExtenderControl)
member.summary: Convert a series of XML animation descriptions into Animations and assign them to their corresponding Animation properties on a provided ExtenderControl instance. This will most likely be called by AnimationExtenderControlBase.Animations, but it is publicly exposed so you can call it in the event your extender cannot inherit from AnimationExtenderControlBase.
member.param: Sequence of XML animation descriptions (i.e. there should not be a root node because it's expecting the inner contents of the <Animations> tag)
Target properties that contains the corresponding Animations

member.name: M:AjaxControlToolkit4.Animation.GetLineNumber(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: GetLineNumber is used when reporting errors in Animation XML descriptions. It will find the line number of the first top level node whose tag matches the provided value.
member.param: Tag of the node to find
member.returns: Line number of the tag, or the first line if nothing found

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Animation.Name
member.summary: Name of the animation (this corresponds to the tag name of the XML description, or the AnimationName property of the JSON description) that matches the name of a registered animation (i.e. this must match one of the names provided on the client in a call to Sys.Extended.UI.Animation.registerAnimation('name', type);).

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Animation.Children

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.Animation.Properties
member.summary: Properties defined for the animation (this corresponds to any of the attributes in the XML description, or any of the members in the JSON description), which specify all the necessary parameters of the animation.

member.name: T:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender
member.summary:
An extender class which adds collapse/expand behavior to an ASP.NET Panel control.
The panel that is extended can then be collapsed or expanded by the user of the page, which is handy for doing things like showing or hiding content or maximizing available space.

member.name: M:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor to enable client state

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.CollapseControlID
member.summary:
The server ID of the control to initiate the collapse of the target panel. The panel will collapse when this control fires its client side "onclick" event.
If this value is the same as the value for "ExpandControlID", the CollapsiblePanel will toggle when this control is clicked.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.ExpandControlID
member.summary:
The server ID of the control to initiate the expansion of the target panel. The panel will opening when this control fires its client side "onclick" event.
If this value is the same as the value for "CollapseControlID", the CollapsiblePanel will toggle when this control is clicked.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.AutoCollapse
member.summary: If true, and the panel is in its 'expanded' state, the panel will automatically collapse when the mouse pointer moves off of the panel.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.AutoExpand
member.summary: If true, and the panel is in its 'collapsed' state, the panel will automatically expand when the mouse pointer moves into the panel.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.CollapsedSize
member.summary:
The size of the panel when it is in it's collapsed state. To avoid flicker when your page initializes, set the initial height (or width) of your Panel control to match this value, and set the Collapsed property to 'true'.
The default value is -1, which indicates that the CollapsiblePanel should initialize the CollapsedSize based on the initial size of the object.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.ExpandedSize
member.summary:
The size of the panel when it is in it's opened state. To avoid flicker when your page initializes, set the initial width of your Panel control to match this value, and set the Collapsed property to 'false'.
The default value is -1, which indicates that the CollapsiblePanel should initialize the ExpandedSize based on the parent div offsetheight if aligned vertically and parentdiv offsetwidth if aligned horizonatally.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.ScrollContents
member.summary: Determines whether the contents of the panel should be scrolled or clipped if they do not fit into the expanded size.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.SuppressPostBack
member.summary:
Determines whether the CollapsiblePanelBehavior should suppress the click operations of the controls referenced in CollapseControlID and/or ExpandControlID.
By default, this value is false, except for anchor ("A") tags.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.Collapsed
member.summary: Signals the initial collapsed state of the control. Note this will not cause an expanded control to collapse at initialization, but rather tells the extender what the initial state of the Panel control is.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.CollapsedText
member.summary: The text to display in the collapsed state. When the panel is collapsed, the internal contents (anything between the start and ending tags) of the control referenced by the TextLabelID property will be replaced with this text. This collapsed text is also used as the alternate text of the image if ImageControlID is set.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.ExpandedText
member.summary: The text to display in the expanded state. When the panel is expanded, the internal contents (anything between the start and ending tags) of the control referenced by the TextLabelID property will be replaced with this text. This expanded text is also used as the alternate text of the image if ImageControlID is set.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.TextLabelID
member.summary: The ID of a label control to display the current state of the Panel. When the collapsed state of the panel changes, the entire HTML contents (anything between the start and ending tags of the label) will be replaced with the status text.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.ExpandedImage
member.summary: Image to be displayed when the Panel is expanded and the ImageControlID is set

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.CollapsedImage
member.summary: Image to be displayed when the Panel is collapsed and the ImageControlID is set

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.ImageControlID
member.summary: The ID of an image control to display the current state of the Panel. When the collapsed state of the panel changes, the image source will be changed from the ExpandedImage to the CollapsedImage. We also use the ExpandedText and CollapsedText as the image's alternate text if they are provided.

member.name: P:AjaxControlToolkit4.CollapsiblePanelExtender.ExpandDirection
member.summary: The dimension to use for collapsing and expanding - vertical or horizontal.

member.name: T:AjaxControlToolkit4.AsyncFileUpload
member.summary:
AsyncFileUpload enables you to you asynchronously upload files to a server. The results of the file upload can be checked both in the server and client sides.
You can save the uploaded file by calling the SaveAs() method in a handler for the server UploadedComplete event.

member.name: M:AjaxControlToolkit4.TabContainerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml(System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection)
member.summary:
This is the main worker function for the designer.
It figures out what the HTML shape of the design-time object should be.
There are three major pieces to this
1. The outer main HTML 2. The HTML that makes up the design time tabs 3. The HTML that is the content for the current tab
Attached to several of these bits of markup are DesignerRegions. Some regions are editable, some are there just to catch clicks to change tabs or add new tabs.
